造.definition: to make; to build; to manufacture; to invent; to fabricate; to go to; party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement); crop; classifier for crops

造作.definition: affected; artificial; to make; to manufacture

造假.definition: to counterfeit; to pass off a fake as genuine

造勢.definition: to boost support or interest; to campaign; to promote

造型.definition: to model; to shape; appearance; style; design; form; pose

造型蛋糕.definition: custom-designed cake (e.g. cake shaped like a guitar, camera or cartoon character)

造字.definition: to create Chinese characters; cf Six Methods of forming Chinese characters 六書|六书[liu4 shu1]

造孽.definition: to do evil; to commit sins

造就.definition: to bring up; to train; to contribute to; achievements (usually of young people)

造成.definition: to bring about; to create; to cause

造橋.definition: Zaoqiao or Tsaochiao township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan

造橋鄉.definition: Zaoqiao or Tsaochiao township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan

造物.definition: luck; to create the universe; god (as the creator of all things); the Creator

造物主.definition: the Creator (in religion or mythology); God

造繭自縛.definition: to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising; hoist with his own petard

造血.definition: to make blood (function of bone marrow)

造血幹細胞.definition: blood generating stem cells (in bone marrow)

造訪.definition: to visit; to pay a visit

造詣.definition: level of mastery (of a skill or area of knowledge); (archaic) to pay a visit to sb

造謠生事.definition: to start rumours and create trouble

造輿論.definition: to build up public opinion; to create a fuss
